text: Find your favourite NESCAFÉ®product and see the caffeine content of mg per serving beside it!

To read the caffeine content level, it will be listed as a range. For example, a caffeine mg per serving of 70 +/- 10 means that the target is 70 mg but there is a range from 60 – 80 mg (i.e. plus or minus 10 from the target).NESCAFÉ GOLD®
NESCAFÉ GOLD® Iced Salted Caramel Latte 50 +/- 10

* +/- 10 means "plus or minus 10 mg", as the amount of caffeine per serving is an approximation.70 +/- 10 means between 60 and 80 mg of caffeine per serving (Approximately 70 mg)90 +/- 10 means between 80 and 100 mg of caffeine per serving (Approximately 90 mg)30 +/- 10 means between 20 and 40 mg of caffeine per serving (Approximately 30 mg)

Thank you for letting us know!
